parameters: This portion of the fresco illustrates an iron door
that evidently confines some sort of a horrid creature
(its clawed and scaled hands grasp the bars of its
small window) that can beloosed to torment prisoners.
The plaster of the fresco is ripped off and
a door leading out of this chamber is revealed
Do you want to go through the door?
You are in a room with brilliant colors everywhere;
pigments painted on stone are undimmed by the
The floor is a colorful mosaic, featuring a distinct,
winding path of red tiles forming a 2-foot-wide,
meandering trail south down the corridor.
A few chips and gaps reveal that cement or plaster
covers the underlying stonework of the corridor, and
it mostly provides a smooth surface for the many
The incredible detail of the paintings hid something
from casual observation that now seems obvious.
A pair of robed, wolf-headed figures are painted on
the wall holding an elaborate bronze chest between
However the chest is no painting, but an actual metal
box imbedded in the plaster, extending only a few
Maybe you could pull the chest away, do you want to
It's more fixed into the wall that what it seems
Looking closely, you see a stud above the box that
probably opens its front. Whould you like to press it?
You press the stud and the box opens, but at first
glance it seems like its empty...
The box seems empty, but you could reach in to be
It seems that a lever was hidden on the top, want to
A section of the red tile path leads into a
mist-filled stone archway. Three large stones
Each has a different hue; yellow on the lower left,
blue at the top of the arch, and orange on the
lower right. They seem like they can be pressed.
What do you want to do?
It seems like you have been warped to another room...
Which stone do you want to press first?
After the blue one, you press the lower right one and
the vapors coming from the portal are dispersed.
After the orange one, you press the top one and
